skill.name: marketplace-release
skill.description: Use when creating releases for Claude Code plugin marketplaces. Supports independent plugin versioning - each plugin can be released separately. Triggered by "release", "bump version", "create release", "publish plugin".
skill.summary: Automate plugin marketplace releases with independent versioning. Bumps versions, creates git tags, and publishes to GitHub.
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: The skill consists solely of documentation (SKILL.md) describing a release automation script. Static findings of external commands, network access, and weak cryptography are all false positives. The skill file contains only documentation with bash command examples - no executable code exists in the skill itself. All detected patterns are safe documentation examples showing legitimate GitHub CLI and Python script usage.

content.value_statement: Managing plugin releases manually is error-prone and inconsistent. This skill automates the entire release workflow including version bumps, git tags, commit messages, and GitHub releases with proper changelog links.
actual_capabilities: Bump patch, minor, or major versions for individual plugins
Create git tags with plugin-specific naming convention
Generate GitHub releases with automatic changelog links
Update version numbers in marketplace.json and plugin.json files
Validate plugins before release using claude plugin validate
Maintain version tables in marketplace README.md automatically
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) with authentication for all operations
Must run from marketplace root directory with valid marketplace.json
Does not support monorepo-style combined versioning
Cannot release plugins with uncommitted changes without acknowledgment

use_cases.title: Release a bug fix patch
use_cases.description: Quickly release a patch version after fixing a bug. The skill bumps the version, creates a git tag, and publishes the release to GitHub with your commit message as release notes.

use_cases.title: Publish a new feature release
use_cases.description: Release a minor version with new features. The skill updates all version references, creates release documentation, and pushes changes to remote with proper tagging.
use_cases.target_user: Plugin authors adding functionality to their plugins

use_cases.title: Coordinate a breaking change release
use_cases.description: Safely release a major version with breaking changes. The skill validates the plugin, updates all version markers, and creates a properly formatted release with upgrade instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic patch release
prompt_templates.prompt: Release a patch version for the [plugin-name] plugin with the message: "[your fix description]"
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a bug fix ready to publish

prompt_templates.title: Feature release
prompt_templates.prompt: Release a minor version for [plugin-name]. The release notes should describe: [feature descriptions]
prompt_templates.scenario: When adding new features to a plugin

prompt_templates.title: Breaking change release
prompt_templates.prompt: Release a major version for [plugin-name]. This is a breaking change. Include these upgrade instructions: [migration steps]
prompt_templates.scenario: When releasing breaking changes requiring user migration

prompt_templates.title: Check current versions
prompt_templates.prompt: List all plugins in this marketplace with their current versions and sources
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to see the current state of all plugins

output_examples.input: Release a patch for ghe with message: Fix avatar loading issue
List all plugins with their versions

best_practices: Validate your plugin before release using the validation script to catch configuration errors early
Run releases from a clean git state to ensure the release commit contains only intentional changes
Use semantic versioning: patch for fixes, minor for features, major for breaking changes
anti_patterns: Do not skip the confirmation prompt without reviewing the version changes first
Do not run releases from plugin subdirectories instead of the marketplace root
Do not forget to authenticate with GitHub CLI (gh auth login) before attempting releases

faq.question: What happens to other plugins when I release one?
faq.answer: Only the specified plugin version is bumped. Other plugins and their versions remain unchanged. Each plugin maintains independent versioning.

faq.question: How does the script know my GitHub repository?
faq.answer: The script uses 'gh repo view' to detect the current repository information automatically. No hardcoded values are required.

faq.question: Can I use version suffixes like -alpha or -beta?
faq.answer: Yes, the script preserves version suffixes. Input '0.2.5-alpha' with a patch bump becomes '0.2.6-alpha'. The tag will include the suffix.

faq.question: What does the plugin validation check?
faq.answer: The validation runs 'claude plugin validate' to verify plugin.json structure, required files, and configuration correctness before release.

faq.question: Where are the version numbers stored?
faq.answer: Versions are stored in two places: .claude-plugin/marketplace.json (marketplace record) and plugins/<name>/.claude-plugin/plugin.json (plugin record).

faq.question: Can I copy this script to another marketplace?
faq.answer: Yes, the release.py script is fully portable. It reads all configuration from marketplace.json and requires no hardcoded paths or user-specific values.
